result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Destiny Monette Martin

records.addlTxt:
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim H.N (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED ON 9-19-22:  SCRAM CAN BE REMOVED.**

9:08 AM Defendant Destiny Monette Martin in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Destiny Monette Martin.  Attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Defense files a bond motion.  State does not object to the modification.  BTC:  Bond modified to a signature bond and SCRAM can be removed.
Bail/bond hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:55 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Destiny Monette Martin in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Destiny Monette Martin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense requests a trial date.  All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems.
Jury trial scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on January 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on January 31, 2023 at 08:30 am.

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Destiny Monette Martin in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Destiny Monette Martin. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  The State has tendered an offer just this past week.  The State was waiting on revocation information.  Parties are still negotiating.  Parties ask for another status.  Court will give one more status.  Defense asks for the GPS to be removed.  State defers to the court. Defense responds.   BTC: Bond modification denied.
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Destiny Monette Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Destiny Monette Martin. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Parties are still negotiating.  Deft. has been revoked.
Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from defendant requesting bond reduction
DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Destiny Monette Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Destiny Monette Martin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
NG plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:19 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Destiny Monette Martin appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared in court for Destiny Monette Martin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense filed a motion to dismiss count one . Argues probable cause.
State objects with argument.
Defense gives argument.
BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. 
State calls Officer LaCombe. DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on cross.
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects.
BTC: Probable cause found, bound over.
Arraignment scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Arraignment on March 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Filed by defense

This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Destiny Monette Martin appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Destiny Monette Martin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Initial appearance on February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
